C

ClackClient - Class in main
The ClackClient class represents the client user.
ClackClient() - Constructor for class main.ClackClient
The default constructor that sets the anonymous user.
ClackClient(String) - Constructor for class main.ClackClient
The constructor that sets the host name to be "localhost" (i.e., the server and the client programs run on the same computer).
ClackClient(String, String) - Constructor for class main.ClackClient
The constructor to set up the port to the default port number 7000.
ClackClient(String, String, int) - Constructor for class main.ClackClient
The constructor to set up the username, host name, and port.
ClackData - Class in data
Class ClackData is a superclass that represents the data sent between the client and the server.
ClackData() - Constructor for class data.ClackData
The default constructor.
ClackData(int) - Constructor for class data.ClackData
The constructor to create an anonymous user, whose name should be "Anon".
ClackData(String, int) - Constructor for class data.ClackData
The constructor to set up the instance variable username and type.
ClackServer - Class in main
The ClackServer class is a blueprint for a ClackServer object that contains information about the port number that clients connect to, a boolean representing whether the server needs to be closed or not, and ClackData objects representing data sent to and received from the client.
ClackServer() - Constructor for class main.ClackServer
The default constructor that sets the port to the default port number 7000.
ClackServer(int) - Constructor for class main.ClackServer
The constructor that sets the port number.
CONSTANT_LISTUSERS - Static variable in class data.ClackData
For giving a listing of all users connected to this session.
CONSTANT_LOGOUT - Static variable in class data.ClackData
For logging out, i.e., close this client's connection.
CONSTANT_SENDFILE - Static variable in class data.ClackData
For sending a file.
CONSTANT_SENDMESSAGE - Static variable in class data.ClackData
For sending a message.
